article.headline: Ball State 59, Detroit 44
article.story: DETROIT (AP) -- Peyton Stovall hit all five of his three-point attempts and scored a career-high 21 points to lead Ball State past Detroit Mercy 59-44 Saturday. Dennis Trammell added 17 points to help the Cardinals post their first win of the season. The Titans (1-2) got eight points each from Ryvon Coville and Ben Green. The Cardinals (1-1) had a double-digit halftime lead and gradually built on it by opening the second half with three consecutive 3-pointers. Ball State finished the game 12-of-21 from behind the arc while the Titans missed all eight of their 3-point tries. Detroit also surrendered 12 second-chance points. Ball State turned the ball over 10 times in the first half but still led 33-19 at the break thanks to a 16-2 run in the final seven minutes of the half. Stovall, who finished the game 8-for-9 from the field, hit all five of his shots in the first half. After tying the score at 17, Detroit managed just two free throws before the intermission.
